newsitem.title: USA: BEFORE THE BELL - Project,Filenet off.
newsitem.headline: BEFORE THE BELL - Project,Filenet off.

text.p: Shares of Project Software & Development Inc and FileNet Corp were hammered in pre-opening trading on Tuesday.
FileNet shares slipped 5-7/8 to 10 at their last sale, traders said, after the company's fourth quarter earnings came in below Wall Street expectations.

FileNet, which makes data processing systems using optical disk technology, released results after the close of trading on Tuesday with fourth quarter earnings per share of $0.20 compared to $0.32 last year.
The earnings were in line with a company forecast in January, when it warned of lower fourth quarter profits because of delayed orders by customers.
A source at PaineWebber said earlier the company was downgraded to hold from buy.
Project Software & Development Inc shares were also selling sharply lower in pre-opening trading.
The stock was off 20, knocking its value down to about 11-1/4.

The company forecast earnings per share of $0.15, compared to $0.24 in the same period last year. Its software is used to maintain high-value capital assets such as plants, facilities and production equipment.
No earlier profit estimates were immediately available for FileNet or Project Software.
